children.subject: Why isn't it just FMAG or something? Linkedin is a subsidiary of MSFT, so it's kinda weird that one division of the company is cool but the rest of it isn't.
What does the L in FLAG stand for
i think faang is more for stocks. like no one at our level works at netflix...
Just curious, is Microsoft somehow less desirable than these lol?
No, FAANG was coined because of how much those stocks were growing. MSFT wasn't growing like that until the last few years. But many include MSFT in the "group" now i'd say.
FAANG should include AMD and NVDA too. The latter two are also selling like hotcakes.

Just curious, you said if you do get a return offer to the startup your tc consists of only 110k base and sign bonus or stocks? Doesn't seem worth it imo because most of the time people join startups in hopes of cashing out through stocks when the company goes to ipo.

FB's new grad offer is 220k a year? How much of that is locked up in RSUs?

You can't possibly be telling me that the wage of some 22-year-old BA holder with a couple of months of industry experience is worth $106 an hour.
FB's new grad offer was 190K, but that is total compensation. Base salary is 120K-130K. Everything else is bonus and stocks.

Maxed out FB return intern offer this summer was 118k base, 220k RSU vested over 4 years, and 100k signing bonus, plus minimum 10% yearly bonus based on base salary (more if you perform well), and 10k relocation putting year 1 total comp at 294.8k.

Lowest return intern offer was 118k base, 160k RSU vested over 4 years, 70k signing bonus, not qualifying for relocation, and

plus minimum 10% yearly bonus based on base salary (more if you perform well) putting year 1 total comp at 239.8k.
Can confirm Anon Atom 2's numbers. It looks like FB pays the most outside of finance.
The Facebook return intern offer is 2x that, so I'd suggest trying to intern there or Google next summer instead of graduating early,

history.content: I’m interning at a growing startup with around 1000 employees. This startup is growing really quickly and is said to have doubled its employee counts last year. And now I can see new people joining the group I’m in very frequently, and it seems like my group will probably double in size at this rate of growth in a few months. So I think this may be a good sign that they’re gonna take off. So if I graduate early I can probably get a return offer here with 110k, which is not high, and I don’t know whether there’s sign on bonus or stock or any other compensation. I can also wait a year to graduate and try for FLAG, but that will cost me one year of OOS tuition. I know startups may boast a bit, so idk whether their plans will come true. Just wondering whether it is good to just join this startup? (Part of the reason is that I’m lazy and don’t wanna grind through the leetcode , and people at this startup are nice in general so I just thought why not lol)
history.subject: Graduate early for growing startup or shoot for FLAG?

history.content: I’m interning at a growing startup with around 1000 employees. This startup is growing really quickly and is said to have doubled its employee counts last year. And now I can see new people joining the group I’m in very frequently, and it seems like my group will probably double in size at this rate of growth in a few months. So I think this may be a good sign that they’re gonna take off. However they still call themselves a startup. So if I graduate early I can probably get a return offer here with 110k, which is not high, and I don’t know whether there’s sign on bonus or stock or any other compensation. But they say they’re gonna go public in two years, and the growing speed of this company looks quite good, and if that becomes reality I can probably get some sellable stock. I can also wait a year to graduate and try for FLAG, but that will cost me one year of OOS tuition. I know startups may boast a bit, so idk whether their plans will come true, but they’re visibly growing quite quickly for sure. Just wondering whether it is good to just join this startup? (Part of the reason is that I’m lazy and don’t wanna grind through the leetcode , and people at this startup are nice in general so I just thought why not lol)
